subject: Junit and Jcoverage Newbie Questions
msgSnippet: I am just started out with these two tools. Jcoverage seems to use Junit tests to see what code have you covered /unit tested. yes? Now i had two questions...
messageBody:
I am just started out with these two tools.

Jcoverage seems to use Junit tests to see what code have
you 'covered'/unit tested. yes?

Now i had two questions... I use ANT to run Jcoverage on my Junit
tests (bascially copied and pasted the ANT script with a few
modifications in the Jcoverage example directory for my project)...
the <junit> xml lang/tasks that you use within ANT, is there
somewhere where it is defined and can read about it somewhere?

Also, Jcoverage itself, when u click on an html report and see yellow
lines... that means the unit tests didnt 'go over' those lines of
code, hence they were not tested/'covered'?

What if my prog in the GUI creates all the Objects by reading in a
file/not given with args[]. how can u unit test that? modify code so
it uses instead a file on command line? or u wouldnt test that as its
not a individual 'unit'?

Thanx,
Arian
